result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Diana Marie Brown was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

w/ Initial appearance

09:46 AM Defendant Diana Marie Brown appeared by video, Attorney Eric Paul Pitsch appeared by video for Diana Marie Brown, Attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has reviewed the Criminal Complaint, reserves all jurisdictional objections and demands a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Based upon the assertion that the charges in the Information will match the charges in the Criminal Complaint, not guilt plea(s) entered. Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for April 1, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:16 Appearances remain the same. 
Discussion held about bail conditions. There is no formal motion and the victim has not had any notification that bail would be discussed. The bail bond does inadvertently missed the specific contact provisions.
If circumstances change, defense is to file a formal motion. No action taken today. Address confirmed. Corrected bail bond to be sent to the defendant for signature.
Scheduling conference on May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Request and Response Regarding Open Records - documents emailed 02-23-2022
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Operate under influence with minor passenger (3rd), on 12-23-21.
Memo from ADA Vendetti moving court date to 02-28-22 at 9:30 a.m.
Blood Search Warrant-Section 968.12, Wisconsin Statutes; Affidavit in Support of Blood Search Warrant; Return of Search Warrant by Law Enforcement Officer.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of operate under influence with minor passenger (3rd).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-14-22 at 9:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no assaultive contact with C.B. and no contact with the child without other adult supervision, defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
